title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 September 2016 - XWiki
content:
<xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
01:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
02:08 <evalica> has quit  
05:19 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
05:20 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
06:50 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
06:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:16 <edvorg> has quit  
07:42 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <tmortagne> has quit  
08:24 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <mflorea> has quit  
08:54 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:34 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <Enygma`1> has quit  
09:50 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <Enygma`> has quit  
09:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <martinus\_\_> Hi, is there an "official" xwiki docker image ?  
10:01 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: almost but not fully yet  
10:01 <vmassol> we started working on one but it's not 100% ready yet but you could try it  
10:01 <vmassol> it's available here:  
10:02 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki  
10:02 <vmassol> wait  
10:02 <vmassol> I've put the latets version on a branch actually  
10:02 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: here: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki/tree/VERSION2  
10:03 <vmassol> note to self: continue the work… :)  
10:03 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, thanks  
10:04 <martinus\_\_> indeed that could be very great to have a fully functional docker image in docker hub ;)  
10:04 <martinus\_\_> I mean useful ;)  
10:05 <martinus\_\_> (until then there's always the zip package)  
10:06 <vmassol> there's better than that  
10:06 <vmassol> you have the debian distirbution too  
10:06 <vmassol> (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT)  
10:08 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, yes, but what I like with zip/manual install  is you can install several instances on the same node easily ;)  
10:08 <martinus\_\_> but for one-time testing the debian packaging is great indeed  
10:11 <martinus\_\_> (vmassol, unless I miss a power step that allow multiple instances with debian packaging :D)  
10:11 <vmassol> martinus\_\_: maybe, I don't know, I've never used it :)  
10:11 <martinus\_\_> lol  
10:11 <vmassol> but the zip distribution is not for production  
10:11 <martinus\_\_> yes, of course  
10:11 <vmassol> it's just for testing  
10:12 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, btw I like the new download page, very clear  
10:12 <vmassol> cool :)  
10:12 <vmassol> thanks for the feedback  
10:12 <vmassol> evalica will be pleased!  
10:12 <vmassol> (she did the new design)  
10:13 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: the debian packages like most debian packages is not designed to have several instances yes  
10:13 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, that's it  
10:15 <martinus\_\_> I have no idea how it could be feasible with debian packages but sure thing : it would be so cool for production env...  
10:16 <vmassol> in prod environment, I doubt you want to run several wikis side by side, do you?  
10:16 <vmassol> (usually you'd use containers / vms to isolate them)  
10:17 <martinus\_\_> well I run several tomcat instances as different users  
10:17 <acotiuga> has quit  
10:18 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> ok  
10:19 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, but I agree it's not a top of the line practice...  
10:21 <martinus\_\_> I may have to talk with Fabio about this...  
10:22 <vmassol> yep  
10:45 <mflorea> vmassol, sice we forked the jodconverter repo https://github.com/xwiki/jodconverter I guess we should also create a jira repo for it so that we can log the issues we fix  
10:46 <mflorea> WDYT?  
10:46 <vmassol> yes  
10:47 <vmassol> do you want me to do it ?  
10:47 <vmassol> (or are you doing it?)  
10:47 <mflorea> sure, go ahead, I guess it needs to be a top level module, XJODC, or JODC  
10:47 <vmassol> yeah but I don't like too much as a  top level  
10:48 <mflorea> I don't like it either but we forked it on xwiki repo not on contrib..  
10:48 <vmassol> yep because it's used by the core  
10:48 <mflorea> maybe we should move it to contrib  
10:48 <vmassol> then we would need to move the office import feature to contrib too  
10:48 <vmassol> since we cannot have a core module use a contrib module  
10:48 <mflorea> ok, then I don't see any alternative to the top level module  
10:49 <vmassol> (s/cannot/shouldn't)  
10:49 <vmassol> mflorea: sure sure I'm just wondering if we shouldn't create a new category for tools or something  
10:49 <vmassol> checking  
10:50 <mflorea> a new category sounds good, but I don't know what else we could "move" there  
10:51 <vmassol> xinfra  
10:51 <mflorea> indeed  
10:52 <vmassol> "Miscellaneous" category? "Others"?  
10:52 <vmassol> or we don't care and I just add it to teh top levels for now and we hope it's not going to confuse users  
10:52 <vmassol> anyway creating it for now  
10:53 <mflorea> ok, let's start with a top level module  
10:53 <vmassol> what are the versions released btw so that I create the versions in jira?  
10:53 <vmassol> hmmm  
10:53 <vmassol> there's another option  
10:54 <vmassol> we create a component in the XWiki Platform jira project for it and we sync the version with platform  
10:54 <vmassol> a bit hacky though  
10:55 <vmassol> yet another option is to move the code to platform  
10:55 <vmassol> seems better to keep it outside though, wdyt?  
10:58 <vmassol> I'm ready to create the new jira project, should I go ahead mflorea?  
10:58 <mflorea> yes  
10:58 <vmassol> @tmortagne any opinion?  
10:59 <vmassol> ok creating in 30 seconds  
10:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: reading  
10:59 <mflorea> outside is better IMO  
10:59 <mflorea> keep the code outside  
10:59 <vmassol> yup  
10:59 <mflorea> I wouldn  
10:59 <mflorea> so I wouldn't use a component in platform  
11:00 <vmassol> mflorea: can you find me the versions in the meantime?  
11:00 <mflorea> 3.0-beta-4-xwiki-20110822  
11:01 <tmortagne> +1 for outside and we could imagine an "Externals" category to follow http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/ naming  
11:01 <mflorea> indeed, an Externals category shoulds good  
11:01 <mflorea> sounds good  
11:01 <vmassol> yes sounds good even though there'd be only one ATM  
11:02 <vmassol> ok doing it  
11:02 <vmassol> mflorea: found it: http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/org/artofsolving/jodconverter/jodconverter-core/  
11:02 <tmortagne> there would be only one because I'm too lazy to have done proper git repository for a few things like pygments jar packaging :)  
11:02 <vmassol> on your machine ATM?  
11:02 <tmortagne> but this one is not exactly an external since I publish it on Maven central anyway  
11:03 <tmortagne> but we have other externals  
11:03 <vmassol> yes I agree anyway  
11:03 <vmassol> doing it  
11:03 <tmortagne> like jython or oauth  
11:12 <vmassol> @mflorea: done  
11:12 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XJOD  
11:13 <vmassol> I'lll let you create the new version  
11:13 <vmassol> (since I don't know what it'll be)  
11:13 <vmassol> :)  
11:14 <mflorea> thanks  
11:17 <vmassol> ANN: e.x.o now has a new home page :)  
11:21 <tmortagne> vmassol: when you click on login under contrib you are then redirected to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Carousel/Section1  
11:22 <tmortagne> should change the text under "All Extensions" since it's not accurate anymore  
11:23 <tmortagne> a pity the tag cloud is so big for no much tags in practice  
11:24 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok fiing  
11:24 <vmassol> \*fixing  
11:24 <tmortagne> for the rest it looks good  
11:25 <vmassol> yes login and register are wrong  
11:25 <Pbas> hello, FYI tag cloud is like this https://snag.gy/xgPDd9.jpg for me (FF + debian)  
11:26 <Pbas> most of tags are grey (quiet invisible)  
11:27 <evalica> Pbas: could you try to refresh the cache? since I haven't seen that ever  
11:27 <evalica> + I did not changed anything on the tagcloud/livetable styling  
11:27 <Pbas> already done!  
11:28 <vmassol> Pbas: you hilighted with your mouse right?  
11:28 <Pbas> yep  
11:28 <Pbas> and grey tags are not hyper link  
11:29 <tmortagne> has quit  
11:29 <Pbas> (I'm not login)  
11:30 <evalica> ok - so that is on mouse highlight, not on view … so in this case not sure what the problem is or what you would have expected  
11:31 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:31 <vmassol> register and login should be fixed now  
11:32 <vmassol> indeed there's a problem with the tags because we're filtienr the LT  
11:32 <vmassol> so it displays all the tags for non recommended extensions too  
11:32 <Pbas> I just started VM machine with XP Pro + firefox 33: same things (but I use same proxy)  
11:32 <vmassol> this is why you can't click on them  
11:32 <mflorea> tmortagne: I'm not sure what version to use for the forked JOD converter. I don't think we have a convention. I'm thinking of using the -xwiki suffix, e.g. 3.1-xwiki-SNAPSHOT, 3.1-xwiki. I'm wondering if EM may have issues with such a versioning scheme  
11:32 <vmassol> this is something we should improve in this tag cloud  
11:33 <vmassol> (ie the tag cloud of hte LT)  
11:33 <vmassol> it could be an option  
11:34 <tmortagne> mflorea: -xwiki is pretty much our de factor standard if not official  
11:34 <tmortagne> that's what I always use  
11:34 <mflorea> ok, good  
11:34 <tmortagne> there is no such thing as invalid version for EM  
11:35 <Pbas> Grey tags are not grey but white (very difficult to see) , no?  
11:35 <vmassol> it needs to be the right order though for upgrades  
11:35 <vmassol> Pbas: they're grey or you woudn't know they're there ;) but as I said that's not the problem  
11:35 <vmassol> the problem is that we should not show them in the recommended LT  
11:35 <Pbas> ok np :)  
11:36 <Pbas> we can not filtering none recommended extension then?  
11:37 <tmortagne> mflorea: when it get 3.1-xwiki it will cut it in 3, 1, xwiki and compare each element one by one so 3.1-xwiki will be higher than 3.1 (because it does not now "xwiki", things likes "SNAPSHOT" or "beta" or something else it knows will produce the opposite: 3.1-SNAPSHOT is lower than 3.1) but lower then 3.2  
11:37 <tmortagne> s/now/know/  
11:40 <Pbas> On the page http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/RecommendedExtensions/RecommendedDefinition/ the link is "You can also check the full list of all Extensions." but this link goto "Recommended Extension"  
11:41 <Pbas> ok sorry (I found the link on my screen on the front of my eyes http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/AllExtensions/)  
11:43 <Pbas> Anyway I resolve my jmx message "There's already a JMX MBean instance type=CacheManager,name="xwiki" already registered under 'org.xwiki.infinispan' JMX domain. If you want to allow multiple instances configured with same JMX domain enable 'allowDuplicateDomains' attribute in 'globalJmxStatistics' config element"  
11:43 <Pbas> I move my xwiki webapps on another subdirectory (and not tomcat/webapps)  
11:44 <Pbas> Because I read this comment : http://stackoverflow.com/questions/7276989/howto-set-the-context-path-of-a-web-application-in-tomcat-7-0  
11:44 <Pbas> However, there is one side effect; your application will be loaded twice. Once for localhost:8080 and once for localhost:8080/yourApp. To fix this you can put your application OUTSIDE <catalina\_home>/webapps and use a relative or absolute path  
11:44 <Pbas> ty  
11:46 <D-Spair> has quit  
11:47 <vmassol> Pbas: fixing link  
11:48 <Pbas> thxs I didn't do it because I wasn't sure ...  
11:48 <vmassol> np  
11:48 <Pbas> :)  
11:52 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <vmassol> disabling tags till http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13680 is fixed  
11:54 <vmassol> (for 29 extensions tags are not that useful ATM anyway)  
11:54 <vmassol> done  
11:55 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes no need for tags in this case  
11:55 <Pbas> and quick! It is most clean I think now :) thxs  
11:59 <tmortagne> vmassol: we need to fix all authors who are not using a name matching xwiki.org name in recommended projects poms  
11:59 <tmortagne> there is acotiuga for example  
11:59 <tmortagne> evalica too  
12:02 <ansuz> q/me labels Feif you want a captive market, go after epi-pen users  
12:03 <ansuz> :/ lagagagag  
12:03 <ansuz> everyone ignore me  
12:05 <ansuz> has left #xwiki  
12:11 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdym?  
12:11 <vmassol> (I don't understand)  
12:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks at http://extensions.xwiki.org  
12:12 <tmortagne> some authors don't have proper links  
12:12 <tmortagne> because they don't have the right user name in the project pom  
12:17 <vmassol> ok I understand  
12:17 <vmassol> just some cleanup  
12:17 <vmassol> evalica: btw could you fix the source link on http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Templates+Application/  
12:18 <vmassol> evalica and acotiuga: could you fix your name in the POms of the various extensions  
12:18 <vmassol> ?  
12:19 <vmassol> see the <developers> section of http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/CreatingExtensions/#HAuthoringaMavenPOMforaXAR  
12:19 <vmassol> <name>Full Name of developer 1 as registered on xwiki.org, e.g. Vincent Massol</name>  
12:19 <vmassol> it seems you''ve put names that don't exist on xwiki.org  
12:19 <vmassol> so either you fix the pom or you fix the name on xwiki.org :)  
12:51 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
13:01 <acotiuga> ok, I'll change something

22:59 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
23:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> Hello everyone, I have a question about the xwiki database. I am looking at the xwiki.hbm.xml file (link https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/stable-7.4.x/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/xwiki.hbm.xml)  
23:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> In particular, I am looking at the length properties of the xwd\_content column, which does not match what my database is telling me the maximum length for the column is  
23:04 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> Could anyone shed some light in how the db schema gets created?  
23:41 <vmassol> sorry xwikiorg\_guest\_2, most of the xwiki developers are sleeping ATM and I'm going to do the same ;) Maybe you could come back later or send us a mail on the users list http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists  
23:41 <vmassol> the db schema gets created by hibernate using the hbm file you mentioned  
23:41 <vmassol> gtg nn, see you tomorrow maybe
